Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.name: Bacterial Spot (Pepper)
Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.treatment: Apply copper-based bactericides (e.g., copper hydroxide). Remove infected plants to prevent spread. Avoid overhead watering.
Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.prevention: Use disease-free seeds, rotate crops every 2-3 years, and space plants for airflow.

Pepper__bell___healthy.name: Healthy Pepper
Pepper__bell___healthy.treatment: No action needed. Maintain good practices to keep plants healthy.
Pepper__bell___healthy.prevention: Regularly inspect leaves, avoid overwatering, and use balanced fertilizers.

Potato___Early_blight.name: Early Blight (Potato)
Potato___Early_blight.treatment: Spray with chlorothalonil or mancozeb fungicides every 7-10 days. Remove lower infected leaves.
Potato___Early_blight.prevention: Rotate with non-solanaceous crops, mulch to reduce soil splash, and avoid nitrogen-heavy fertilizers.

Potato___healthy.name: Healthy Potato
Potato___healthy.treatment: No action needed. Monitor for pests/diseases.
Potato___healthy.prevention: Practice crop rotation, ensure well-drained soil, and remove weeds.

Tomato__Target_Spot.name: Target Spot (Tomato)
Tomato__Target_Spot.treatment: Apply fungicides containing azoxystrobin or pyraclostrobin. Prune affected leaves.
Tomato__Target_Spot.prevention: Use resistant varieties, avoid overcrowding, and sterilize tools between uses.

Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus.name: Tomato Mosaic Virus
Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus.treatment: No cure. Remove and destroy infected plants. Disinfect tools with 10% bleach solution.
Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus.prevention: Use virus-free seeds, control aphids (vectors), and avoid smoking near plants (tobacco mosaic risk).

Tomato__Tomato_YellowLeaf__Curl_Virus.name: Tomato Yellow Leaf Curl Virus
Tomato__Tomato_YellowLeaf__Curl_Virus.treatment: Remove infected plants immediately. Use insecticides like imidacloprid to control whiteflies (vectors).
Tomato__Tomato_YellowLeaf__Curl_Virus.prevention: Plant resistant varieties (e.g., 'TYLCV-resistant'), use reflective mulch, and monitor whiteflies.

Tomato_Bacterial_spot.name: Bacterial Spot (Tomato)
Tomato_Bacterial_spot.treatment: Apply copper sprays + mancozeb. Destroy severely infected plants.
Tomato_Bacterial_spot.prevention: Avoid working with wet plants, use drip irrigation, and rotate crops.

Tomato_Early_blight.name: Early Blight (Tomato)
Tomato_Early_blight.treatment: Spray with copper or chlorothalonil. Remove lower leaves to improve airflow.
Tomato_Early_blight.prevention: Stake plants, mulch heavily, and rotate away from tomatoes/potatoes for 3 years.

Tomato_Late_blight.name: Late Blight (Tomato)
Tomato_Late_blight.treatment: Apply fungicides (e.g., chlorothalonil, copper) at first sign. Destroy infected plants.
Tomato_Late_blight.prevention: Avoid overhead watering, space plants widely, and choose resistant varieties (e.g., 'Defiant').

Tomato_Leaf_Mold.name: Leaf Mold (Tomato)
Tomato_Leaf_Mold.treatment: Use fungicides like chlorothalonil. Prune for better airflow.
Tomato_Leaf_Mold.prevention: Reduce humidity in greenhouses, water at the base, and rotate crops.

Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.name: Septoria Leaf Spot (Tomato)
Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.treatment: Apply copper or mancozeb fungicides. Remove infected leaves.
Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.prevention: Mulch to prevent soil splash, avoid overhead watering, and sterilize tools.

Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_m.name: Spider Mites (Tomato)
Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_m.treatment: Spray with neem oil, insecticidal soap, or miticides (e.g., abamectin). Introduce predatory mites (Phytoseiulus persimilis).
Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_m.prevention: Increase humidity, avoid dusty conditions, and remove weeds that host mites.
